list_definition.definition: a thin, flat wrapper or cover, especially for a letter

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The letter arrived in a long envelope.

list_ex_of_english: The pump and seed envelopes are shown multiplied by 10 for clarity.
A caryopsis was considered germinated as soon as the radicle pierced the envelopes.
All booklets were collected and immediately sealed in envelopes before being taken from the room.
The silence at the end is part of the infinite horizon where all morphological envelopes meet.
A lifetime of five and one-third hours a day of counting envelopes is not obviously preferable to seven hours a day of being a lawyer.
Both parents were asked to complete the questionnaires independently and return them in sealed envelopes at the first visit.
Stationary instrumental groups are placed around the audience and successively play sounds of the same pitch and timbre with similar dynamic envelopes (crescendo-decrescendo).
They employed a conditioned head-turning technique and found that infants discriminated between tones that differed only in the spectral envelopes.
